thread.title: Going on vacation in Boston? Study says Airbnb cheaper than hotels
thread.title_full: Going on vacation in Boston? Study says Airbnb cheaper than hotels

author: Catherine Carlock
title: Going on vacation in Boston? Study says Airbnb cheaper than hotels
text:
Going on vacation in Boston? Study says Airbnb cheaper than hotels Aug 3, 2015, 2:13pm EDT Industries & Tags Catherine Carlock Real Estate Editor Boston Business Journal Catherine Carlock Real Estate Editor Boston Business Journal Related Content WeNeedaVacation.com In Nantucket, a vacation rental home costs an average of $354 per night compared to an… more It’s 38 percent cheaper to stay in a Boston-area vacation rental home such as Airbnb than to stay in a hotel — but that’s not necessarily the case in Cape Cod and Nantucket, according to a new study by San Francisco-based travel website Hipmunk. Hipmunk bills itself as “the first travel website to show vacation rentals alongside hotel results.” The study included data from Airbnb, Homeaway and VacayHero, including both apartments and private rooms, alongside hotel room rates to determine the most economical vacation accommodations. In Boston, an average nightly rental rate is $186, compared to an average nightly hotel rate of $301 — an average savings of $115 per night, the Hipmunk study shows. In Nantucket, vacation rentals cost an average of $354 compared to an average hotel rate of $368 — a savings of just $14. And on Nantucket, savings are a meager $9 for a vacation rental, with an average rate of $222 per night compared to $231, the study shows.
